posts.author: darktooth
posts.content:
The following are questions which I haven’t found an answer in the nwnwiki:

1. Does the spell failure from deafness stack with spell failure from taunt?

2. A PC equips a small shield (+5% spell failure) but with this property (-50% reduced spell failure). In the character sheet, the chance of spell failure shows 0%. If the PC is taunted and struck deaf, what would be the total chance of spell failure?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
1. Afaik, it stacks negatively.

2. It "stacks", meaning that the "-45" that is nor being shown on the character sheet (re: it lies) is still present - if one equips, for example, armor with spell failure, that spell failure will be reduced up to -45.

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content: So in the case above, does spell failure from deafness (20%) stack with taunt (30%) and if it does, does the PC with small shield have a total chance of 5%? If he equips armor with the same property, will it nullify the spell failure?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
AFAIK, that would seem to be the case.

I don't think that the source of the spell failure is relevant to the game engine - just the end result (meaning there are not different kinds of spell failure).
